Material used.Description: Ion channel formation was analyzed using phosphatidylcholine bilayers.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Altered ion channel conductivity and selectivity
Readout description.Result Description: E46K mutation reduced channel conductivity by 40% and increased selectivity for K+ over Na+ compared to wild-type. GM3 gangliosides restored normal conductivity, while GM1 had no effect.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control for ion channel formation.

Basic negative control.Description: No α-synuclein was used as a negative control for ion channel formation.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare channel conductance between wild-type and E46K mutant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Channel conductivity within ±15% of wild-type values.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Channel conductivity deviating by >25% from wild-type values.

Material used.Description: Monolayer stability and α-synuclein interactions were analyzed using Langmuir monolayers.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Reduced monolayer stability and altered surface interactions
Readout description.Result Description: E46K mutation decreased monolayer stability by 30% compared to wild-type. GM3 gangliosides enhanced stability, while GM1 had no effect.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly described in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type α-synuclein was used as a positive control for monolayer stability.

Basic negative control.Description: No α-synuclein was used as a negative control for monolayer stability.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare monolayer stability between wild-type and E46K mutant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Monolayer stability within ±15% of wild-type values.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Monolayer stability deviating by >25% from wild-type values.
